#summary The <svg> element represents the root node of an SVG document or image.  It is analagous to the <html> element in an HTML document.
You are here: [Welcome Home] > [SVGElements SVG Elements] > *svg element*

= Introduction =

The [SVGSVGElement <svg> element] represents the root node of an SVG document or image.  When included in an XML context (inline with XHTML or as a standalone SVG document), the [SVGSVGElement <svg> element] must include the SVG namespace (see [SVGSVGElement#Usage Usage] below).

= Details =

== Usage ==

{{{
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="100%" height="100%" viewBox="0 0 300 200">
  <!-- rest of SVG document goes here -->
</svg>
}}}

== Attributes ==

Common attributes:

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/struct.html#SVGElementWidthAttribute width] - if unspecified this value is 100%
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/struct.html#SVGElementHeightAttribute height] - if unspecified this value is 100%
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/coords.html#ViewBoxAttribute viewBox] - represents the coordinate system of the SVG document

== DOM API ==

The [SVGSVGElement <svg> element] supports the DOM [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/struct.html#InterfaceSVGSVGElement SVGSVGElement interface].  Some of the noted methods of SVGSVGElement are:

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Core/core.html#ID-536297177 NodeList] getIntersectionList( SVGRect rect ):
    * returns the list of nodes whose bounding boxes intersect with the input rectangle
    * supported by Opera 9+
    * NOT yet supported by Mozilla, see [http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=501421 this bug]
    * NOT yet supported by Webkit, see [http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=11274 this bug]
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Core/core.html#ID-536297177 NodeList] getEnclosureList( SVGRect rect ):
    * returns the list of nodes whose bounding boxes are completely enclosed by the input rectangle
    * supported by Opera 9+
    * NOT yet supported by Mozilla, see [http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=501421 this bug]
    * NOT yet supported by Webkit, see [http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=11274 this bug]
